Note:
Cf. Stevens (1961)
XStevens, John. Music and Poetry in the Early Tudor Court. London: Methuen, 1961, 427.
Subjects: Margaret, queen of Scotland; James IV, king of Scotland
_description: Carol or refrain-song, perhaps connected with marriage of Princess Margaret to Janes IV of Scotland, A.D. 1503

NYPLDrexFr4180.Transcription:
…red rosse fayre and sote off sent trew off [c]olowregood lord
                    graunt both off þat dyspocicionThe red rosse [ ]Be twene thes
                    fflowrys the rose and the thystyllIn hyr all [ ][ ] in hyr all
                    honowreIn hyr all trowyth engendryd by alyaunce[ ] as stalke as trew
                    as tyrtyllAs debonoure as gentyll off bewte a n[ ][ ] her per cam
                    neuer in scotlond ne in franceThe rede…
NYPLDrexFr4180.Note:
Portions of pages cut away to fit as endleaves to seventeenth-century
                    song book.
